title: Retiring dominion. ARE YOU SERIOUS?
body:
http://www.godlikeproductions.com/sm/4bfce9e6.gif

Are you guys seriously going to remove a 4year old mode that has 5 mins queues from the fucking game?!!? I play this mode all the time a lot of ppl play this mode, TONS read TONS of diamond+ play this mode all the time, ppl play hide n seek in this mode and other things, and btw some games would weep to have 5 min queues so what gives you the right to take this away from us after almost FIVE YEARS LATER!?!?!?!?!?

Edit: Let's also not forget how in less than a season riot has removed team 5vs5 queues, ranked draft TT queues TB queues and ruined ARAM when they added a Lee Sin Q on steroids as a summoner, all that in less than a single season, we are now on season S.I.X and they are removing content left and right instead of adding more.
By season 8 you will play SR how they want it and you will like it or gtfo simple has that...fine by me.
 I love the game they created and have been playing way too much for far too long but if riot himself goes out of their way to push ppl away from their own game than so be it. 
More money for me less money for them i guess.

 Holy shit, Riot. All that money and you can't support two maps? Really? Best company in the world and you can only manage to fuck up balance in one place?

Nah smite is balance through making everything op. Honestly i wish riot would head in this direction. I've found most Smite games come down to a lot of skill and knowing when to strike.

Man, what a load of crap. Instead of just giving the map a full rework they just stomp it completly. What irritates me the most is that they put Dominion on the same level as their temporary game modes, which is total bollocks. Hexakill, Doombots, All For One, Urf… those are all simple SR games with some parameters changed.

i don't even like dominion

but the most BS statement in that was a reply to why can't they just remove the que and leave it in custom games

this was the absolutely pathetic rito reply


Some inbred ritoer:

Unfortunately, keeping Dominion available in Custom games still has the same cost as being a matchmade queue. :/ We have to ensure all champions work with capture points, items, etc.
The art on the map is also far behind what we'd consider the 'quality bar' for League nowadays. It would be a herculean SRU level effort to bring it up to parity (when we could better spend that time/resources doing something awesome on SR instead).

what a fucking crock of shit

Except it's absolutely true.  Keeping Dominion up requires extensive bug testing of every new champion/item that comes out to make sure it doesn't break any of the (several) mechanics unique to Dominion.  This is true whether it has its own queue or if it's just in customs.  Why would Riot spend hundreds of man-hours continuing to bug test content that less than half a percent of their player base ever uses?

If that actually were true, we would be seeing the removal of ARAM and TT as well, but we're not, because it isn't.  They're removing dominion because they, personally, don't like it, it has no fans among the developers, who have shuffled between neglect and outright abuse of the game mode and its playerbase for years, solely because they don't like it and don't want to deal with it, completely disregarding the millions of players who _did_ enjoy the game mode, and only ever left it _because_ of Riots neglect and abuse.

Dominion had 45 second queue times for _two solid years_ after its release.  Queues of a minute and a half after that, and has only up to 5 minute queues for less than a year, more or less since the fanmade leagues disappeared with the reorganization of the forums into boards.

It always had a playerbase, and there is no reason it couldn't have been cultivated and grown, if Riot hadn't _actively_ and very successfully tried to starve and kill that playerbase for the entire four years it was on live.

If Riot didn't like Dominion they wouldn't have added it in the first place.  People didn't stop playing Dominion because Riot forced them to, they stopped playing Dominion because _not very many people like Dominon._  It just doesn't have the widespread appeal of the other game modes.  The fact of the matter is that very few people play it and it isn't worth the cost of upkeep.  They're not removing ARAM or TT because those game modes actually have a large enough player base to justify continuing to support them.

Forty five second queues for two years would say otherwise, there would have to be tens of thousands of concurrent and active players in a single region for that to be so, and I can promise you it was, I was there.  I've only played a handful of SR games in the last four years, and this 0.5% of players and 5 minute queue times BS is less than a year old, and a lame excuse from a prejudiced group of developers who actively _tried_ to get people to stop playing this game mode.

Your only evidence here is "trust me, queue times totally used to be short, lol".  Assuming there's some kind of Riot conspiracy to destroy Dominion just because you noticed queue times going up is paranoid in the extreme.  Myself, and a lot of my friends, have tried to get into Dominion in the past and have burned out on it really quickly.  It's a common reaction - it's fun for a bit but then you go back to the other modes.  The fact that Dominion player numbers dropped over time makes sense because that's how a lot of people feel about it.  Just face the facts: not enough people like Dominion to keep supporting it.  Riot didn't destroy it on purpose.  It just doesn't have the appeal.

No, my only evidence is a statement of fact, as anyone who has consistently played dominion over the last four years will tell you the same thing about the queue times and size of the playerbase.  It was plain for anyone to see who actually participated.  And, oh surprise!  You didn't participate, haven't played it, have no idea what you are talking about and no knowledge to speak of on this subject.

They had years of opportunity in which it had more than a large enough playerbase that they could have supported this game mode, improved upon it, and attempted to grow said playerbase, and they didn't.  Admittedly, it might not have worked, it may have never grown a lot, but with support it would haven't have shrunk, stagnated, and died; and now, since they put forth _absolutely zero effort_ for over four years, we'll never know.

There was no fiscal, design, or technical reasons why they couldn't have supported this game mode.  The only reason left, because they chose not to, because they picked a favorite and went all in on it, choosing to degrade and despise another game mode and its players until they killed its playerbase off and no longer had to answer to any substantial amount of players for removing the game mode, and relieving themselves of any responsibility for it or requirement to support it.

They have wanted this game mode to die, for years.  And the breaking of the organization of the fan league less than a year ago, was the last step they needed to do it without any retaliation from any sizable portion of the playerbase.

I have played it. The queue times were not that short all the time. When they were very short it was because there were multiple bots in the game which sucked all the possible fun out of the game. But then without those bots.... long queues and not exactly the greatest gameplay made it good for a short change of pace but little else.

Also you're demonizing them out of anger and making terrible arguments, please stop. They had every fiscal, design, and technical reason to not support it. Yes they chose to focus on SR instead, and have said as much. And I think it was the right choice. But sometimes the right choice involves some negative consequences too, including pissing some people off.

Let Dominion RIP, anger isn't going to change what's true.

First they came for the AP off-builds, but I did not main a champion with an AP off-build, so I did not speak out. 

Then they came for the Cinderhulk junglers, but I did not main a Cinderhulk jungler, so I did not speak out.

Then they came for Cassiopeia and Mordekaiser, but I did not main either of those champions, so I did not speak out.

Then they came for the mana dependent casters, but I did not main a mana dependent caster, so I did not speak out.

Then they came for Dominion, but I never play Dominion, so I did not speak out.

And then they came for me. But everyone else had already moved on to a different game, so there was no one left to speak for me.

Incoming unpopular opinion.

While I'm sure there are plenty of people who played dominion exclusively, and were / are dedicated to it, overall there are very few people who play it. .5% of all league players play it, with a good portion of those being bots.

I imagine the amount of resources and effort to fix Dominion would be too great. They have troubles keeping one game mode balanced to an acceptable state wothout having to worry about a second mode.

I think the map should still be usable for custom ganes (heard that you won't be able to) and if that is the case then that is wrong. You may not agree with Riot's choice, but I do firmly believe they are doing what they believe to be best for overall game health and player enjoyment. I have no doubts some people will stop playing after this, and that is completely understandable.

Quick edit here: I think this is important to say. While I, and many others, don't always agree with Riot's choices, I firmly believe that Riot cares very deeply about the game and the community. Please keep that in mind with your posts guys. When you openly insult Riot, claim they don't care, etc, it drives them further away from the community. They have been communicating to us way better than they used to (Riot Rep is amazing, I've seen all sorts of red posts on this forum as well lately). Criticize them for their decision, but don't claim they don't care.
Your argument would be good, except Dominion is and has always been more balanced than Summoner's Rift.

I'll give you that I don't play dominion so I don't exactly know what the balance state is currently. That said, they would still need to take the time to observe it properly, make sure it is balanced, fix the bot situation, fix and bugs (known and possibly unknown ones) and still dedicate more resources to bring it up to par. The art assests are completely out of date as an example.

They would also have to some how fix player perception of the game mode. I could be wrong in saying this, but I think it is simply too much work for too little of a reward (player enjoyment).

A long time ago "player enjoyment" was what the whole point of League of Legends was. It wasn't supposed to be a massive esports cash cow. It was supposed to be a fun moba without all the BS that DotA had.
I think that is true for the majority of players still actually. The ESports community is there for those who are interested, but by no means is that what LoL has solely become.

Your argument about mode balance would make more sense if Riot actually balanced alternate maps on a consistent basis. The only champion balance changes since August 2014 have been stacking changes for Gangplank and Garen after their reworks. Aside from that, there's only been the TT mini-rework and ARAM's Mark/Dash fiasco. For 18 months of time, that's not exactly a lot of resources going towards non-SR balance.

They SHOULD get more balance to all of the other maps on a more consistent basis in a perfect world. But we know that's not the case of reality.  One of my points was that since they already have troubles balancing one game mode, do you think they will be more successful if they diverted resources to focus on another mode? Or would it make both modes less fun to due to the diverted attention?

Really, they could be successful at doing both. I don't know. Neither do you. The only people who can judge what they are capable of reliably is Riot themselves. My only real criticism behinf their choice is to remove the map from custom mode. That is a disservice to those who do / did enjoy the map and would love to continue enjoying it for fun with friends.

Dominion is significantly easier to balance than the Rift, there is no farming and no carry system since it is nigh impossible to beat the passive gold and XP gain.  Its balance issues were in movement and skill uptimes and early game carries, all easily addressed.

The only thing that made balancing dominion difficult, was that no one ever even tried.

Plus, the queue times, bots, and low player percentage are something that developed over time, and only got this bad very recently.  Dominion had a more than large enough playerbase for _several years_ after its release for riot to have supported the game mode, and they didn't even try, not even for a day, let alone the years they had, and that playerbase only decreased _with_ Riots neglect and abuse, not in spite of it.

>The only thing that made balancing dominion difficult, was that no one ever even tried.
